entries.title: Manchester City: Former captain Vincent Kompany 'sceptical' of critics
entries.description: Former Manchester City captain Vincent Kompany says he is "very sceptical" of people "pointing fingers" at the club, which has been charged with breaking the Premier League's financial rules.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Race to find quake survivors' and a 'scar' on police
entries.description: David Carrick's sentencing and the continued search for earthquake survivors lead the front pages.

entries.title: Formula 1 president Stefano Domenicali says the sport will 'never put a gag on anyone'
entries.description: Formula 1 president Stefano Domenicali says the sport will "never put a gag on anyone" amid controversy over freedom of speech.

entries.title: FA Cup: Billy Sharp and Sander Berge late goals end Wrexham's run
entries.description: Billy Sharp and Sander Berge score injury-time goals as Sheffield United end non-league Wrexham's FA Cup run in a pulsating fourth-round replay.

entries.title: Turkey earthquake: What are UK charities doing to help?
entries.description: A range of charities are trying to help with things such as medical aid, shelter and food.

entries.title: Sheffield United 3-1 Wrexham: Stoppage-time goals end National League side's FA Cup run
entries.description: Billy Sharp and Sander Berge score injury-time goals as Sheffield United finally end non-league Wrexham's FA Cup adventure in a pulsating fourth-round replay.

entries.title: Grimsby Town 3-0 Luton Town: League Two side shock Championship high-fliers in replay
entries.description: Grimsby Town stun Championship high-fliers Luton to reach the FA Cup fifth round for the first time since 1996.

entries.title: Women's Indian Premier League: Nat and Katherine Sciver-Brunt get highest reserve price in auction
entries.description: England players Nat and Katherine Sciver-Brunt, Sophie Ecclestone and Danni Wyatt enter the inaugural Women's Premier League auction at the highest reserve price.

entries.title: Public Order Bill: Peers defeat plans to curb protest disruption
entries.description: The government suffered a series of heavy defeats to its Public Order Bill in the House of Lords.

entries.title: Turkey earthquake: Yeni Malatyaspor goalkeeper Ahmet Eyup Turkaslan dies
entries.description: Turkish second division club Yeni Malatyaspor confirm goalkeeper Ahmet Eyup Turkaslan has died following Monday's earthquake in his home country.

entries.title: Civil servants set to strike on Budget day
entries.description: The PCS union plans a second walkout as the row with the government over pay escalates.

entries.title: Turkey earthquake: Bodies in street after quake as anger grows over aid
entries.description: The death toll in Turkey continues to rise as survivors struggle to find shelter and support.

entries.title: Leeds United: Where did it go wrong for Jesse Marsch and who could replace him?
entries.description: BBC Radio Leeds' Adam Pope looks at why Jesse Marsch failed at Leeds United and who could replace him as they look to avoid relegation.

entries.title: China spy balloon: US Navy releases photos of debris
entries.description: The suspected Chinese surveillance balloon was shot down over the Atlantic on Saturday.

entries.title: David Bowie's handwritten Jean Genie lyrics sold for £57,000
entries.description: The handwritten sheet was given to the founder of the inaugural David Bowie fan club by the star.

entries.title: Turkey-Syria earthquake: Newborn baby pulled from collapsed building
entries.description: Dramatic video showed a rescuer carrying the girl, whose mother, father and four siblings were killed.

entries.title: Oscars: Danielle Deadwyler claims Hollywood is 'deeply impacted by racism'
entries.description: Danielle Deadwyler and Viola Davis were tipped to be nominated for best actress, but missed out.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak's 'maths until 18' plan questioned by experts
entries.description: The PM's idea won't work without big changes to the education system, experts say.

entries.title: Turkey earthquake: Mexico sends its famed search and rescue dogs
entries.description: Quake-prone Mexico has expert teams of humans and canines specialised in searching through rubble.

entries.title: Kaylea Titford: Tragic teen left to die alone at home by parents
entries.description: How did a strong-willed and funny teenager become a victim of negligence and die of morbid obesity?

entries.title: Paris Olympics 2024: Nordic nations join calls for ban on Russian and Belarusian athletes to be upheld
entries.description: The Olympic committees of five Nordic nations back calls for the ban on Russian and Belarusian athletes to be upheld for the Paris 2024 Games.

entries.title: Chris Mason: A reshuffle about rewiring, rather than firing
entries.description: Rishi Sunak has focused on reorganising departments, rather than sacking ministers, says political editor Chris Mason.

entries.title: Dominic Raab accused of bullying behaviour by ex-colleague
entries.description: An ex-senior civil servant talks anonymously to BBC Newsnight about the deputy prime minister's conduct.

entries.title: Women's sport: Research shows increase in viewers in 2022
entries.description: The amount of time the average viewer spent watching women's sport in 2022 is more than double the 2021 figure, according to new research from the Women's Sport Trust.

entries.title: Humza Yousaf's family drops discrimination case against nursery
entries.description: The health secretary and his wife, councillor Nadia El-Nakla, have halted a £30,000 discrimination case.

entries.title: England: Captain Leah Williamson returns as Sarina Wiegman's side look to defend Arnold Clark Cup
entries.description: Captain Leah Williamson returns to Sarina Wiegman's England squad as they look to retain the Arnold Clark Cup.

entries.title: Nicola Bulley: Police still believe missing mum fell into river
entries.description: Officers say they are "fully open" to new information and are following about 500 lines of inquiry.

entries.title: Trump-era Chinese spy balloons went undetected
entries.description: They may have been classified as UFOs, or unidentified anomalous phenomenon, at the time, reports say.

entries.title: Margaret Thatcher portrait saved from tip breaks sale expectations
entries.description: Gifts to the ex-prime minister saved from destruction by a waste worker sell for a total of £15,000.

entries.title: Manchester City finances: What do Premier League charges mean?
entries.description: BBC Sport answers the key questions after Manchester City are charged by the Premier League with more than 100 breaches of financial rules.

entries.title: The Afghan women cyclists who fled the Taliban to pursue Olympic dream
entries.description: Since arriving in the UK from Afghanistan, Mina, Persia and Arifa have been training twice a week.

entries.title: Sunak reshuffle: Shapps named energy secretary in department shake-up
entries.description: Lucy Frazer leads a streamlined department of culture, media, and sport as the PM changes his team.

entries.title: Joe Allen: Wales midfielder retires from international football
entries.description: Wales midfielder Joe Allen announces his retirement from international football at the age of 32.

entries.title: Kourtney Kardashian's Lemme gummies? Don't bother, say experts
entries.description: Doctors have doubts about the vitamin sweets being advertised on Instagram by Kourtney Kardashian.

entries.title: Kaylea Titford: Dad found guilty of daughter's manslaughter
entries.description: Alun Titford is found guilty of gross negligence manslaughter of 16-year-old Kaylea Titford.

entries.title: Archie Battersbee: Mum tells inquest his death was an accident
entries.description: The 12-year-old died four months after he was found unconscious at the family home in Southend.

entries.title: PM reshuffle: Rishi Sunak's new top team - and why it matters
entries.description: Rishi Sunak's made changes to his top team. The BBC's Ione Wells explains why it matters from Westminster.

entries.title: David Carrick: Serial rapist Met Police officer jailed for at least 30 years
entries.description: Met Police officer David Carrick took "monstrous advantage of women" in crimes spanning two decades.

entries.title: Cost of living: Big banks' bosses defend savings rates and branch closures
entries.description: The bosses of Lloyds, NatWest, HSBC and Barclays said deals had improved as savers shopped around.

entries.title: Man arrested over 11-year-old girl's disappearance in Galashiels
entries.description: The child went missing on Sunday but was found at a property in the Scottish Borders on Monday night.

entries.title: Super Bowl 57: Patrick Mahomes and Jalen Hurts making NFL history in Arizona
entries.description: We look at why having two black quarterbacks in the Super Bowl is a such a big moment for the NFL, and profile star men Patrick Mahomes and Jalen Hurts.

entries.title: Turkey earthquake: Three Britons missing, says Foreign Office
entries.description: More than 5,000 people are now known to have died in the earthquake which happened on Monday.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Russians seen reinforcing east ahead of offensive
entries.description: Tens of thousands of Russians are being sent to eastern Ukraine, the Luhansk governor says.

entries.title: David Carrick: How a monster finally lost control
entries.description: A detective tells BBC News how the former police officer and serial rapist was finally stopped.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: Wales lock Alun Wyn Jones now fit to face Scotland
entries.description: Wales lock Alun Wyn Jones is deemed fit for the Six Nations trip to Scotland on Saturday after initially being ruled out.

entries.title: Police vetting: What is it and how are complaints dealt with?
entries.description: How are police officers vetted and how does the complaints process work?

entries.title: Turkey earthquake: Unanswered cries as survivors wait for help
entries.description: The sense of loss is spreading quickly in Turkey, the BBC's Tom Bateman reports from Adana.

entries.title: New Zealand v England: Jack Leach says tourists looking to 'peak at right time'
entries.description: England are looking to "peak at the right time" after cutting their only warm-up match before the Test series in New Zealand, according to Jack Leach.

entries.title: Richard Sharp: BBC chairman denies giving Boris Johnson financial advice
entries.description: Richard Sharp is grilled by MPs about his involvement in arranging a loan for Boris Johnson.

entries.title: Mark Cavendish robbery: Two men jailed over raid at cyclist's home
entries.description: Two men broke into the Olympian's home when he was in the property with his wife and children.

entries.title: Beyoncé tickets: High demand as UK concerts go on general sale
entries.description: Some users get an error message on Ticketmaster, others are kicked out of the 500,000-strong queue.

entries.title: Epsom College deaths: Teacher and daughter shot by husband, police believe
entries.description: Epsom College head Emma Pattison was found dead with her daughter Lettie and husband George.

entries.title: Formula 1: Alfa Romeo become first team to unveil 2023 design
entries.description: Alfa Romeo are the first team to unveil a 2023 Formula 1 design, with the target of continuing the progress they made last year.

entries.title: Disabled Shropshire man completes seven-day marathon feat
entries.description: Darren Edwards has finished a gruelling seven global marathons in a week.

entries.title: Dramatic rescue saves Thai baby who fell down well
entries.description: The 19-month-old child slipped between a 30cm (12in) wide gap and fell to the bottom of the well.

entries.title: Simon Middleton: Reflecting on the England coach's legacy - and who will be next?
entries.description: Simon Middleton is leaving after eight years in charge of England - but where will the RFU look for his replacement.

entries.title: Turkey and Syria earthquake: ‘It was like a doomsday scenario'
entries.description: Ismael had just left his son in hospital when the building started to collapse.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: England forwards coach Richard Cockerill to leave
entries.description: Richard Cockerill will leave as England forwards coach after the Six Nations in order to join French club Montpellier.

entries.title: Leeds: Patrick Bamford a 'joke' for criticising Jesse Marsch tactics - Chris Sutton
entries.description: Leeds United striker Patrick Bamford should have kept his criticism "within the dressing room", says ex-forward Chris Sutton.

entries.title: World War Two sailor feared dead in torpedo attack turns 100
entries.description: Morrell Murphy's family was told he had been killed in the attack by a German submarine in 1944.

entries.title: Harry Styles' Grammys routine went in wrong direction, dancers reveal
entries.description: Harry Styles and his dancers discover on live TV that the stage didn't just go in one direction.

entries.title: Christian Atsu: Footballer 'removed from wreckage with injuries' after earthquake
entries.description: Footballer Christian Atsu is pulled from the rubble of a building "with injuries" after devastating earthquakes in Turkey.

entries.title: Disney removes Simpsons 'forced labour' episode in Hong Kong
entries.description: Disney cuts the episode from its streaming platform amid concerns over the Chinese territory's laws.

entries.title: Match of the Day 2: Why Everton can be 'confident' about Merseyside derby
entries.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Mark Chapman, Leon Osman and Nedum Onuoha discuss how Everton can be "confident" ahead of the Merseyside derby next week in the Premier League.

entries.title: Epsom College: Investigations continue after family found dead
entries.description: Emma Pattison was found dead with her husband George and their seven-year-old daughter Lettie.

entries.title: Energy giant BP sees record profits of $28bn
entries.description: The firm's profits more than double after energy prices surged last year following the invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: Folarin Balogun: The English youngster at Reims outscoring PSG's big three
entries.description: Have you heard the one about the English youngster outscoring Kylian Mbappe, Lionel Messi and Neymar who is set to give Arsenal a "positive headache"?

entries.title: Beyoncé: Renaissance hat designer flooded with orders
entries.description: Abby Misbin says she charged the singer's team $215 for the handmade glitter ball cowboy hat.

entries.title: LGBTQ: Plan to make it easier to change gender in Wales
entries.description: But the UK government said it would block similar legislation put forward by the Scottish government.

entries.title: Turkey quake: Heavy rain hampers rescue efforts
entries.description: More than 4,300 people are confirmed dead in the quake that struck northern Syria and Turkey.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Saved from hell' after 'biggest quake in 84 years'
entries.description: The rescue efforts after two earthquakes in Turkey left thousands dead leads the front pages.

entries.title: Nicola Bulley: Search expert says he is 'totally baffled' by case
entries.description: The underwater search for Nicola Bulley continues, as detectives focus on a river path.

entries.title: Turkey earthquake: The world rallies in the face of disaster
entries.description: See in pictures how the world is rallying around Turkey and Syria following a devastating earthquake.

entries.title: Adani Group: Can embattled India tycoon recover from $100bn loss?
entries.description: The group's valuation has plunged after a short-seller raised fraud allegations. What's the way out?

entries.title: Turkey earthquake: Aleppo among worst-hit areas in Syria
entries.description: More than 1,400 people are killed in Syria after a huge earthquake strikes neighbouring Turkey.

entries.title: Drone footage shows earthquake aftermath in Turkey
entries.description: Drone footage showed massive destruction in Turkey's border province of Hatay on Monday.

entries.title: Women 'have suffered after Brits changes'
entries.description: All Saints singer Shaznay Lewis says "female artists have suffered" as a result of recent changes.

entries.title: Trial of scrapping train return tickets extended
entries.description: The transport secretary will explain how tickets can be simpler for passengers in a speech on Tuesday.

entries.title: One in five homes have not cashed energy vouchers
entries.description: Figures show that 19% of households did not redeem their vouchers in October and in November.

entries.title: What three luxury homes reveal about who owns UK property
entries.description: Despite new transparency laws, the owners of 50,000 British premises remain hidden from public view.

entries.title: A wave of tool theft spurs hi-tech security systems
entries.description: Desperate to protect their tools from being stolen, tradespeople are considering sophisticated security systems.
